boardgame.name: Cuba Libre
boardgame.description: In December 1956, paroled rebel Fidel Castro returned to Cuba to launch his revolution with virtually no political base and_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash;after a disastrous initial encounter with government forces_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash;a total of just 12 men. Two years later, through masterful propaganda and factional maneuver, Castro, his brother Ra_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;uacute;l, and iconic revolutionary Che Guevara had united disparate guerrillas and exploited Cubans_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo; deep opposition to their dictator Fulgencio Batista y Zald_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;iacute;var. Castro_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s takeover of the country became a model for Leftist insurgency._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Castro_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s Insurgency_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Following up on GMT Games_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo; Andean Abyss about insurgency in modern Colombia, the next volume in the COIN Series, Cuba Libre, takes 1 to 4 players into the Cuban Revolution. Castro_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ldquo;26 July Movement_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; must expand from its bases in the Sierra Maestra mountains to fight its way to Havana. Meanwhile, anti-communist student groups, urban guerrillas, and expatriates try to de-stabilize the Batista regime from inside and out, while trying not to pave the way for a new dictatorship under Castro. Batista_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s Government must maintain steam to counter the twin insurgency, while managing two benefactors: its fragile US Alliance and its corrupting Syndicate skim. And in the midst of the turmoil, Meyer Lansky and his Syndicate bosses will jockey to keep their Cuban gangster paradise alive._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;COIN Series, Volume II_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Cuba Libre will be easy to learn for Andean Abyss players_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash;both volumes share the same innovative GMT COIN Series system. Like Volume I, Cuba Libre is equally playable solitaire or by multiple players up to 4_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash;and with a shorter time to completion than Andean Abyss. But Cuba Libre_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s situation and strategic challenges will be new. A deck of 48 fresh events brings 1950s Cuba to life and includes _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;hellip;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; The Twelve: The first wave_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s escape to the Sierra Maestra_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash;inspirational legend or harbinger of defeat?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; El Che and Ra_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;uacute;l: Brilliant in the field, or bungling hostage-takers?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; Operation Fisherman: Can the rebels pull off a second invasion?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; General Strike: Urban disruption or rebel embarrassment?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; Radio Rebelde: Are the masses tuning in, or just the Army direction finders?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; Pact of Caracas: Can the rebels unite?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; Armored Cars: Mobile striking power, but in whose hands?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; Rolando Masferrer: Brutal pro-government tactics_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash;will they help or hurt?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; Fat Butcher: Can the Mob_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s enforcer protect its casinos?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; Sinatra: Frankie_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s Havana show a boom or bust, and who collects?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;hellip; and much more._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;New twists match the COIN Series system to the situation in 1950s Cuba:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s the insurgents who build lasting capabilities, while the Government is limited to fleeting bursts of momentum._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; The Syndicate_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s bases are Casinos_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash;expensive to build, but so important to Cuba no army will destroy them. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; Syndicate special activities include calling in the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ldquo;muscle_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; of Government troops and police to protect mob assets. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; Stacks of Syndicate cash awaiting launder can fall in anyone_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s hands_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash;even the corrupt Government_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; The Government has its own terror tactic_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash;reprisals_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash;and can skim a portion of Syndicate profits._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; The eroding US Alliance with Batista overshadows all Government actions, not just through aid levels but also through the day-to-day ability of troops and police to operate._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; Even if Batista flees, the struggle may not end_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash;the counterrevolutionary government may even become stronger!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Multiplayer, 2-Player, Solitaire_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Cuba Libre provides up to 4 players with contrasting roles and overlapping victory conditions for rich diplomatic interaction. For 2- or 3-player games, players can represent alliances of factions, or the game system can control non-player factions . Or a single player as the Cuban Revolutionaries can attempt to topple Batista and seize power for themselves. The non-player sides will fight one another as well as the players, but too much power in the hands of any one of them will mean player defeat._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;More COIN Series Volumes to Come_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Andean Abyss and now Cuba Libre present a game system on modern insurgency readily adaptable to other conflicts, particularly those featuring the interaction of many sides (thus the name COunterINsurgency Series). A rich and under-represented history of guerrilla warfare beckons, as modern insurgency offers virtually unlimited, under-gamed topics for the COIN Series. Volume III is A Distant Plain—Insurgency in Afghanistan. Volume IV is Fire in the Lake—Insurgency in Vietnam._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
